page.title: 06SHOPS AND SHOPPING
page.content: The last two remaining shops in the area closed down some years ago owing to lack of customers.A small shop has survived in Staplefield and this is run on a voluntary basis by people in the village.It opens from 2 to 5 pm each day and any profits go towards the village.Most grocery items are sold & customers are pleased it's there.A mobile shop also tours the area. There is a small nursery in Slaugham selling plants,& a very large garden centre situated just off the northbound carriageway of the A23.A few farms sell produce like eggs & vegetables but apart from this most shopping is done outside the area , mainly in Crawley & Haywards Heath. Most people have one main shopping trip to one of the above towns each week.
